decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The works shall be carried out and maintained in accordance with the deposited Fire Statement compliant with Policy D12(A).Reason: In the interests of fire safety and to ensure the safety of all building users in accordance with Policy D12 (Fire Safety) of the London Plan 2021.

Prior the commencement of any development above ground level, detailed drawings at a scale of 1:20  of the following features shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority :- Elevational drawings of the proposed replacement double glazed/ thermally efficient timber doors and sash windows (including manufacturer specification). Including details of thermal efficiency, dimensions and colour.- Soldier course header including materials- Details of window reveals/ recesses ( these to be the same as the existing windows)- Sliding gate to driveway and pedestrian gate  including materials - Toughened glass balustrade  including fixtures and fittings- Replacement bargeboards/ soffits, including the materialsThe development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details and drawings.Reason : To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan and policies CS8 and DM10  of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to commencement of the development to which this permission relates (including any works of demolition), detailed design of the installation of proposed timber sash windows and french doors together with the solider course header, together with a method statement for their construction , shall be submitted  to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The works shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details.Reason : To prevent harm to the significance of designated heritage assets, in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM12 of the LDF Core  Strategy 2012.These details are required prior to commencement of development to safeguard any heritage assets present on the site

Prior to the  beneficial occupation of the development, the applicant must install a minimum of two bat boxes on  the property or nearby. The necessary bat boxes must be installed away from windows and artificial light sources and must be sited a minimum of 5m above ground level.Reason: To safeguard the biodiversity and nature conservation value of the site, in accordance with policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS3 and DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012 and The Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (as amended)

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, any windows or rooflights at  first floor level  or above in the Proposed Rear North Elevation  and Proposed Side East Elevation (Drg No LIV_21_P3_112)  and Proposed Front South Elevation and proposed Side West Elevation  ( Drg No LIV_21_P3_111) serving bathrooms shall be constructed so that no part of the framework less than 1.7m above finished floor level shall be openable. Any part below that level shall be fitted with and permanently retained in obscure glazing to a minimum of level 3 on the standard scale. Any film used to achieve the requisite obscurity level shall be non-perishable, tamper-proof, and shall be replaced immediately in the event that it ceases to result in obscurity to level 3.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

In the context of the setting of the dwellinghouse and its close proximity with Richmond Royal Park, details of an extenal lighting scheme following the guidance from the Bat Conservation Trust 'Bats Artificial Lighting at Night' (2023) shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority . The applicant must not design an external lighting scheme where the external lighting is directed towards the Royal Park.Reason: To safeguard the biodiversity and nature conservation value of the site, in accordance with policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS3 and DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012 and The Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (as amended).
application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: Minor landscaping works to front of property, new timber windows, external decoration works and new glazed balustrade to rear balcony, alteration to fenestrations. Erection of gate.
